column1: The municipality's territory includes Bongao Island (where the poblacion is located)
column4: as well as the western end of Tawi-Tawi Island.

column1: Bongao is politically subdivided into 35 barangays.
Evidence of human presence in Bongao was carbon-dated to be 8
column4: signifying one of the earliest known evidence of human presence in Southeast Asia. The bones
column7: and other artifacts and fossils were found in the Bolobok Rock Shelter Cave Archaeological Site
column8: which has been declared as an Important Cultural Treasure by the government in 2017.Much of the Bongao area was the center of Bajau culture and arts for hundreds of years. By the 14th century
column9: Muslim missionaries from Arabia arrived and established the first ever mosque in the Philippines. The area was heavily converted to Islam
column10: especially when the Sultanate of Sulu in nearby Sulu province was founded.

column1: The province of Tawi-tawi was never officially controlled directly by the Spanish as the Sultanate of Sulu was in a perpetual war with Spain
column2: resulting to the preservation of its Muslim and Bajau cultures. However
column3: the sultanate waned and was captured by Spain
column4: only to be handed to American forces after a few years. Sibutu remained under Spanish rule until 1900.

column1: Before the armed rebellion of the MNLF in the early 1970s
column2: Bongao was merely a backwater village ruled by the prominent noble Halun family
column3: who used to own about three-quarters of the island. The capital of the province was Batu-Batu (in Panglima Sugala) in the mainland situated in a cove with deep waters suited for anchors of the Philippine Navy. At the height of the armed rebellion and fearing that the provincial capitol might be overrun
column4: the government transferred it to Bongao. The white-washed
column5: Taj Mahal-inspired provincial capitol building is located on a hill overlooking the bay and the whole town to the North of the Island against the backdrop of Mount Kabugan and the famous Bud Bongao (Bongao Peak).

column1: The transfer of the seat of government ushered the rapid development of the island as the southernmost center of commerce and trade. Suddenly
column2: the population swelled as individuals (and their families) who are in government service moved to the town.
Bongao is a minuscule cosmopolitan site that is becoming a model of multicultural society. In downtown Bongao
column3: there are mosques for the majority Muslim population

column1: The municipality is the home of the Balobok Rock Shelter-Cave Archaeological Site
column2: which carbon dates the existence of humans on Tawi-Tawi for 5
column5: making it one of the earliest human settlement site in Southeast Asia. The entire archaeological site has been declared as an Important Cultural Property by the National Government in 2017.

column1: The main thoroughfare is Datu Halun Street
